lines.text: Well, maybe instead of setting himself on fire, the fire was to... protect him, somehow.
Yeah, fire- well known for its defensive properties.
No, like... Slick was pointing a gun at him, right?
So, maybe the idea was to create a literal smokescreen- something flashy and distracting that'd throw off his aim!
...Fat lot of good that did 'im, huh?
No matter how you slice it, it's hard to figure out why Slick would let the guy start a fire at all.
Wouldn't he have said ''nobody move or I'll shoot'', or somethin' like that?
Man, we've been over this, right? He already had the candle, he was standing right there...
Hrm. I guess. Still don't sit right with me.
If the idea was to have fire block Slick's view...
Why would he end up all the way across the room, where there wasn't any fire between him and Slick?
Slick... he's gotta be the key to this <c=#FF00FF>somehow.</c>
